S4.T2.caption: Table 2: Omniglot results. MAML results are taken from the original work of Finn et al.Â [15], and first-order MAML and Reptile results are from Nichol et al.Â [43]. iMAML with gradient descent (GD) uses 16 and 25 steps for 5-way and 20-way tasks respectively. iMAML with Hessian-free uses 5 CG steps to compute the search direction and performs line-search to pick step size. Both versions of iMAML use Î»=2.0ğœ†2.0\lambda=2.0 for regularization, and 5 CG steps to compute the task meta-gradient.
